Class.name: ZeroCopy.Tree
Class.Description: Experimental class to support connected tree forest

Property.name: TempGlo
Property.Description: By default uses @TempGlo PPG storage or the whole forest (i.e. it's redirected to CACHETEMP) You could use any local or global for those purposes

Property.name: DefaultValue
Property.Description: Property allows to reefine default value for undefined tree nodes Empty string is default, but you are free to change it

Property.name: AutoCleanup
Property.Description: Cleanup all created trees upon object closure

Property.name: KnownTrees
Property.Description: Root pointers for all known so far named trees, i.e. for $this.DocumentContent it would be i%KnownTrees("DocumentContent") pointing to the ..TempGlo subtree

Property.name: SubsTLB
Property.Description: cache of recently translated/walked subscripts might point to differennt global altogether TODO - limit cache size to N recentmost walks

Property.name: KeepObjects
Property.Description: we need to keep opened [and their storage retained] all zerocopy objects we were merged with. So keep object handy, increasing their reference counters

Method.name: %OnClose
ReserveTree
AddTree
DumpTree
PurgeAllTrees
Method.Description: Kill temporary storage for all existing trees kept in the @TempGlo. Don't use it!
Method.Implementation: kill @TempGlo

Method.name: RetainObjectsRef
Method.Description: increment reference to the object to make sure it will be kept around till our own closure

Method.name: KillSubtree
Method.Description: if there are some nodes underneath - just kill them
Method.Implementation: if GloRef = "" { quit } kill @GloRef

Method.name: MakePtr
Method.Description: create special $listbuild(42, value) content to recognize pointers from the average string or numeric
Method.Implementation: $listbuild(42,S)

Method.name: IsPtr
Method.Description: Check whether the passed string value is our "Pointer" or not [it should be valid $lb and their 1st entry has to be 42 (don't ask)
Method.Implementation: $listvalid(P) && ($list(P,1) = 42)

Method.name: GetPtr
Method.Description: Extract actual pointer value from their encoded $lb(42,Ptr)
Method.Implementation: $list(P,2)

Method.name: Assign
Method.Description: Assign value (scalar or object) to the multi-dimensional node @GloRef

Method.name: GloRef
Method.Description: Factory method returning "smart-pointer" wrapped as ##class(TreePtr) object
Method.Implementation:
#dim ptr As TreePtr = ##class(TreePtr).%New() // no extra arguments, access to the root set ptr.TreeObject = $this set ptr.DocTreeName = Property set ptr.GloRef = ..CalcTreeGloRef($get(..KnownTrees(Property)), Args...)
return ptr

Method.name: CalcTreeGloRef
Method.Description: Given arguments as subscripts, the @TreeGloRef as root of storage return the final global reference (no check for existence), also pass back the calculated @encodedSubs as binary key

Method.name: GetValue
Method.Description: actual implementation of a getter, given @GloRef reference

Method.name: GetMultiArrayDirect
Method.Description: Getter for unknown multidimensional property (i.e. DocumentContent) silently invokes tree walker

Method.name: GetMultiArray
%DispatchMethod
Method.Implementation: return ..GetMultiArray(Method, Args...)

Method.name: SetMultiArrayDirect
SetMultiArray
%DispatchSetMultidimProperty
Method.Implementation: do ..SetMultiArray(Property, Val, Subs...)

Method.name: %DispatchSetProperty
Method.Implementation: do ..SetMultiArray(Property, Val)
